Duct Cleaning & Sealing

Revolutionary AeroSeal Technology for Maximum Energy Efficiency

30% Average energy savings
95% Duct leakage reduction
1 Day Complete service

The Hidden Problem in Your Home

Most homes lose 20-40% of their heated and cooled air through leaky ductwork. This invisible problem costs you money every month and affects your family's comfort.

Energy Waste

Leaky ducts force your HVAC system to work harder, increasing energy bills by hundreds of dollars annually.

Comfort Issues

Uneven temperatures, hot and cold spots, and difficulty maintaining desired temperatures throughout your home.

Air Quality Problems

Leaky ducts pull in dust, allergens, and pollutants from crawl spaces, attics, and wall cavities.

HVAC System Strain

Overworked systems break down more frequently and have shorter lifespans due to duct leakage.

Common Duct Problems

⚠

Disconnected Ducts

Complete separation at joints

⚠

Loose Connections

Gaps at duct connections

⚠

Holes & Tears

Physical damage to ductwork

⚠

Poor Installation

Inadequate sealing from start

Revolutionary AeroSeal Technology

AeroSeal is the only duct sealing technology that seals leaks from the inside out, reaching areas that traditional methods cannot access.

How AeroSeal Works

AeroSeal uses advanced aerosol technology to seal duct leaks from the inside. Tiny particles suspended in air flow through your ductwork and automatically seal holes and gaps up to 5/8 inch.

Patented Process

Developed at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory and proven in thousands of homes.

Precise Targeting

Sealant particles only stick to leak edges, not duct surfaces, ensuring optimal airflow.

Real-Time Monitoring

Computer-controlled process provides before and after measurements with guaranteed results.

The AeroSeal Process

1

Pre-Sealing Inspection

We measure and document existing duct leakage using specialized equipment.

2

System Preparation

Registers are blocked and the system is prepared for the sealing process.

3

AeroSeal Application

Sealant particles are injected into the ductwork and automatically seal leaks.

4

Real-Time Monitoring

Computer tracks sealing progress and provides immediate feedback on results.

5

Final Testing

Post-sealing measurements confirm the level of duct leakage reduction achieved.

6

Certification

You receive a detailed report showing before and after results with warranty information.

Professional Duct Cleaning Services

Complete duct cleaning removes years of accumulated dust, debris, and contaminants for healthier indoor air quality.

Improved Air Quality

Remove dust, pollen, pet dander, and other allergens that accumulate in ductwork over time.

Better HVAC Efficiency

Clean ducts allow for better airflow, reducing strain on your heating and cooling system.

Odor Elimination

Remove musty odors, pet smells, and other unpleasant odors trapped in your ductwork.

Allergy Relief

Reduce allergens circulating through your home's air for better respiratory health.

Our Thorough Cleaning Process

Inspection & Assessment

We inspect your entire duct system to identify problem areas and develop a cleaning plan.

System Protection

We protect your home and furnishings during the cleaning process.

Powerful Vacuum Extraction

High-powered vacuum systems remove debris while preventing contamination spread.

Agitation & Brushing

Specialized brushes and agitation tools dislodge stubborn debris from duct surfaces.

Sanitization (Optional)

EPA-approved sanitizers can be applied to eliminate bacteria, mold, and odors.

Final Inspection

We verify all ducts are thoroughly cleaned and your system is ready for optimal operation.

When Do You Need Duct Services?

High Energy Bills

Unexplained increases in heating and cooling costs may indicate duct leakage.

Uneven Temperatures

Some rooms too hot or cold while others are comfortable suggests duct problems.

Dusty Home

Excessive dust accumulation despite regular cleaning indicates duct contamination.

Allergy Symptoms

Increased respiratory issues or allergies may be caused by contaminated ductwork.

HVAC Cycling

System running constantly or cycling frequently suggests efficiency problems.

Age of System

Ductwork over 10 years old likely has accumulated debris and developed leaks.
